page.title: 09BEELINE TRANSPORT,WARMINSTER
page.content: Village children returning home from the town school, pensioners on a day trip to the sea, housewives collecting the weekly shopping - almost everyone in Warminster has at some time used the services of "Beeline", a local company that runs a fleet of coaches and a taxi business as well. Mr Roy Hayball, the Managing Director of "Beeline", moved from Yeovil to start the company in 1969. Based at his Boreham Road depot, he has gradually built up his coach business including contracts for school buses. In 1985 he employs 10 full-time staff with a fleet of 10 coaches. A typical coach costs about Â£50,000 but the most valuable coach owned by the company is worth Â£60,000. Mr Hayball has a strong interest in Road Safety and believes that coaches are the safest vehicles on the road.
